metadata.name: Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On MacOS Host
metadata.comment: Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host. Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('/teamviewer_service')) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/teamviewer_desktop')) AND endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/teamviewer_desktop --ipcport 5939 --module 1')))

output.summary: Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host. Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of TeamViewer Reference: Internal Research
